thread.title: USU football: Utah State ranks 21st in the nation in rushing defense
thread.title_full: USU football: Utah State ranks 21st in the nation in rushing defense

title: USU football: Utah State ranks 21st in the nation in rushing defense
text:
Oct. 10, 8:30 p.m. 5 Days 17 Hrs 14 Mins 28 Secs 
Following its 33-18 Homecoming victory against Colorado State on Saturday night, Utah State’s defense now ranks among the top 40 in the nation in six categories, including ranking third in the Mountain West and 30th in the nation in total defense (323.2 ypg). 
Overall, the Aggies rank among the top-40 teams in the nation in 10 different categories. 
Utah State also ranks second in the MW and 21st in the nation in rushing defense (107.5 ypg), second in the MW and 41st in the nation in scoring defense (20.5 ppg), fifth in the MW and 64th in the nation in pass efficiency defense (121.8), seventh in the MW and tied for 42nd in the nation in sacks (2.25 pg), and seventh in the MW and 64th in the nation in passing defense (215.8 ypg). 
Utah State’s defense has only allowed 74 first downs through four games (18.5 pg), which ranks third in the MW and tied for 23rd in the nation. The Aggies have also allowed just 19 third-down conversions on 61 attempts (.311) to rank third in the MW and 35th nationally. 
Utah State has forced at least one turnover in 36 of its last 41 games, including six turnovers this season with four fumble recoveries and two interceptions. In all, the Aggies have forced 83 turnovers in their last 41 games. 
Utah State has intercepted 38 passes in its last 28 games, including multiple interceptions in 12 of those 28 games, and has at least one interception in 18 of its last 24 games. The Aggies have also scored one defensive touchdown this year and nine defensive touchdowns in the last 26 games. Last season, USU scored five times on defense. 
Furthermore, the Aggies have held their opponent out of the end zone in the first quarter in 33 of the last 46 games and scoreless in the first quarter in 23 of the last 46 games. Overall, USU has led at the end of the first quarter in 32 of its last 46 games and is 27-5 in those contests. Utah State was 6-2 last season and is 13-2 under head coach Matt Wells when leading at the end of the first quarter. 
Utah State’s defense has held 23 of its last 44 opponents without a first-half touchdown, while seven of its last 44 opponents have been held scoreless in the first half. The Aggies have led at the half in 34 of their last 44 games and are 30-4 in those contests. USU was 10-1 last season and is 19-2 under Wells when leading at the half. 
Through the past three seasons, Utah State has done a good job of dealing with sudden change as it has allowed a total of 75 points following 43 turnovers for an average of 1.74 points per turnover. Through four games this year, USU’s defense has allowed just one touchdown following six Aggie turnovers. During the 2013 season, USU’s defense allowed 55 points following 21 turnovers. And during the 2012 season, the Aggie defense allowed just 13 points following 16 turnovers. 
Offensively, the Aggies ranks third in the MW and tied for 17th nationally in sacks allowed (1.0 pg), fifth in the MW in completion percentage (.549), seventh in the MW in passing (168.5 ypg), ninth in the MW in total offense (328.0 ypg), 10th in the MW in rushing (159.5 ypg), and 11th in the MW in scoring offense (19.0 ppg) and passing efficiency (101.2). 
On special teams, Utah State ranks third in the MW and tied for 34th in the nation in punt returns (12.4 ypr) and is fourth in the MW and 51st in the nation in kickoff returns (22.4 ypr). 
Individually, senior LB Kyler Fackrell ranks second in the MW and tied for 15th nationally in tackles for loss (1.75 pg), tied for second in the MW and tied for 27th nationally in fumbles recovered (0.25 pg), tied for fourth in the MW and tied for 59th nationally in fumbles forced (0.25 pg), tied for ninth in the MW and tied for 45th nationally in sacks (0.75 pg) and tied for 36th in the MW in tackles (5.5 pg). 
Junior LB Nick Vigil ranks first in the MW and tied for 10th nationally in tackles (10.8 pg), while redshirt senior QB Chuckie Keeton ranks second in the MW and 45th in the nation in completions (18.3 pg), third in the MW and 75th in the nation in total offense (204.0 ypg), third in the MW and 77th in the nation in passing (179.0 ypg), fourth in the MW in completion percentage (.545) and ninth in the MW in pass efficiency (95.8). 
Junior WR Andrew Rodriguez ranks third in the MW and tied for 17th nationally in punt returns (17.0 pg). Sophomore CB Jalen Davis ranks fourth in the MW and tied for 23rd in the nation in passes defended (1.50 pg), is fifth in the MW and 38th in the nation in punt returns (10.8) and tied for 10th in the MW in interceptions (0.25 pg). 
Redshirt freshman FS Jontrell Rocquemore ranks tied for second in the MW and tied for 27th in the nation in fumble recoveries (0.25 pg), and tied for fourth in the MW and tied for 59th nationally in fumbles forced (0.25 pg). 
Junior FS Devin Centers ranks tied for 10th in the MW in interceptions (0.25 pg) and tied for 31st in the MW in tackles (5.8 pg). Senior CB Tyler Floyd and senior DE Jordan Nielsen rank tied for second in the MW and tied for 27th in the nation in fumble recoveries (0.25 pg). 
Senior CB Deshane Hines ranks third in the MW and tied for 49th nationally in fumbles forced (0.33 pg). Senior NG David Moala ranks tied for fourth in the MW and tied for 59th nationally in fumbles forced (0.25 pg). Senior LB LT Filiaga ranks tied for fifth in the MW and tied for 51st nationally in tackles (8.8 pg). 
Junior PK Brock Warren ranks tied for first nationally in field goal percentage (1.000) and PAT percentage (1.000), and is third in the MW and tied for 46th nationally in field goals (1.25 pg), while redshirt freshman P Aaron Dalton ranks 11th in the MW and 98th in the nation in punting (38.1 ypk). 
The Aggies return to action on Saturday, Oct. 10, when they hit the road for the first time in Mountain West action, facing Fresno State at Bulldog Stadium in Fresno, California. The game kicks off at 8:30 p.m. MT, and will be televised on the CBS Sports Network. Recommended Stories
